title: 107_hr2653
content: The "Agricultural Credit Act of 2001" may be cited as the short title. The Act defines debt forgiveness. Section 343(a)(12)(B) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to exclude certain actions from the definition of debt forgiveness, such as loan consolidation, rescheduling, reamortization, or deferral, as well as write-downs due to financial problems related to natural disasters or medical conditions. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to exclude certain actions from debt forgiveness, including write-downs related to discrimination complaints against the Secretary. SEC. 3. Loan eligibility for borrowers with prior debt forgiveness. Loan eligibility for borrowers with prior debt forgiveness is restricted under Section 373(b) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. Borrowers who have received debt forgiveness on more than two occasions are prohibited from receiving loans under certain conditions, with exceptions for those who have undergone restructuring or are current on payments under a reorganization plan. SEC. 4. Allocation of funds for socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers is amended to allow pooling and reallocation to other states as determined by the Secretary. SEC. 5. Exception to term limits on operating loans only for disasters or emergencies. In amending Section 311(c) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act, direct operating loans are now available for farmers affected by natural disasters or emergencies designated by the President. The Emergency Assistance Act allows farmers affected by natural disasters or economic emergencies to receive guaranteed operating loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. The Emergency Assistance Act allows farmers affected by natural disasters or economic emergencies to receive guaranteed operating loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. The Act specifies that the economic emergency must be determined by the Secretary. SEC. 6 amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act regarding shared appreciation arrangements, specifying a percentage of recapture after restructuring. SEC. 7 makes a technical correction by redesignating subsections.
